results.title: Exploring the Pharmacological Potential of Metformin for Neurodegenerative Diseases
results.text_hl: It has been revealed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can play a neuroprotective role by regulating energy metabolism, oxidative stress, @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ response and protein deposition of cells, and avoiding @DISEASE_Neurologic_Manifestations @DISEASE_MESH:D009461 @@@neuronal dysfunction@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal death@@@.

results.title: Metformin as a potential neuroprotective agent that influence Parkinson's disease.
results.text_hl: Despite some conflicting results from animal and clinical research, we believe that the evidence suggests a potential role for @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ as a treatment for @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal disorders@@@, and further research is needed to establish this.

results.title: Metformin attenuates cadmium-induced degeneration of spiral ganglion neuron via restoring autophagic flux in primary culture.
results.text_hl: The results of this study reveal that autophagy dysfunction is an important component of @CHEMICAL_Cadmium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002104 @@@Cd@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@SGN degeneration@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may be a potential protective agent for attenuating @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@SGN degeneration@@@ following @CHEMICAL_Cadmium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002104 @@@Cd@@@ exposure.
